qas.question: When does  Dirty Mas take place on the Monday before Ash Wednesday?
What do the costumes worn by the revelers pun about?
How are the King and Queen of J'ouvert chosen?

answers.text: based on their witty political/social messages

context: J'ouvert, or "Dirty Mas", takes place <a0_0>before dawn<a0_0/> on the Monday (known as Carnival Monday) before Ash Wednesday. It means ""opening of the day". Revelers dress in costumes embodying puns on <a1_0>current affairs,<a1_0/> especially political and social events. "Clean Mud" (<a2_0>clay<a2_0/> mud), oil paint and body paint are familiar during J'ouvert. A common character is "Jab-jabs" (<a3_0>devils<a3_0/>, blue, black or red) complete with pitchfork, pointed horns and tails. A King and Queen of J'ouvert are chosen, <a4_0>based on their witty political/social messages<a4_0/>.
